designations.source: A review of the status of Larger Brachycera flies of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Larger Brachycera flies last undertaken in 1991, using a more modern IUCN methodology for assessing threat
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: A taxon is Endangered when it is not Critically endangered but is facing a very high risk of extinction in the wild in the near future.
designations.comments: Recorded at only two sites in two hectads since 1990, and previously known from only 6 other hectads from another part of the small range. Its rapid rise and fall at the original centre of its distribution indicates extreme fluctuations in its population. It has declined by at least 75% from its earlier period of occurrence between 1938 and 1951.
